intro: Leria stenocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed leria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and striking, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring or early summer. Leria stenocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
